I was struggling with life in general. I had to go and get blood tests done for a medical issue. I had been self harming in the few days before that and was absolutely mortified at the nurse having to see my arms. I made some sort of banal joke about it (my go-to defense system to prevent sympathy from others) and she looked me dead in the eyes, stroked my arm and said 'honey, you are perfect just the way you are'. It hit me hard.
Northern Territorian here. Definitely intentional. Not endorsed by government. Out loud, anyway.
Legit made me squirm

He told me that he loved me about a week after we started seeing each other. Major red flag and almost a deal breaker. A little more than a year later, we are engaged and he has flown across Australia twice to be with me for family funerals. I can't imagine life without him. I'm so glad I ignored that red flag.
Why do you know that?!
When I found him threatening a police officer with a fishing spear.

My other half asks me every day what I want for tea, and when I tell him he says, 'nah we're not having that.' so why ask?

I kept thinking that about every year previous to this one. But then 2018 hit. Moved house, had an injury, then a car accident. Lost both of my cats, then both of my puppies. Moved house again, moved shop, lost my grandfather. Flew cross country for his funeral and a week after I got back, my father passed away. Flew back again for his funeral which damn near ended me. Got home, dog goes into labour, emergency surgery after hours and lost her puppy. Injured myself again, had to have emergency surgery. But I did get engaged so there's that.
I remember a friend told me once that most people don't think about suicide daily. It actually blew my mind, I had no idea. I just thought everyone else dealt with those thoughts better than I did.

I decided to go to university one day high. I thought I looked normal. I opened my car door and my friend took one look at me and says, 'Are you high?!'. I guess I was wrong about looking normal. That class happened to be a textiles class. My hand was dyed blue for weeks because I was so mesmerised by the swirling fabric in the dye. My lecturer asked if I was ok. I never tried that again but damn that was a fun class.
'This is my country. Have a blessed day.'
Umm... Don't.
What would you have chosen?
S'mores. Not really sure what they are, but they're always mentioned in the context of camping in books, so I'm all in.
First time I cut my skin to the fat. It shocked me.
Hit me with a German swear word
Pronunciation and definition?

Not so much a store, but I was in the anaesthesiologists office getting checked before surgery. Part of the checks was a pregnancy test. The nurse (male, if it matters) looked at me with a shocked expression and said, 'congratulations!!' after a half a heartbeat and a thousand thoughts he followed with 'you're not pregnant!' I was there for exploratory surgery to find the cause of my infertility. What an ass.
When I lost my virginity. He gave me head and fell asleep on my thigh. I just laid there for an hour because I was too much of an introvert to shove him off.
Getting woken up early when I told everyone not to wake me up unless it's an emergency

Happy birthday! How about fish and chips on the beach with a good book? Or go exploring through a shopping centre you've never been to?

I texted an acquaintance 'happy 40th birthday!!'. That was the extent of the text, and the first text I had sent him. His girlfriend called me and screamed at me for 30 minutes, telling me amongst other things that she was going to abort his baby because of me and that she was going to find me and beat the crap out of me. I noped out of that friendship immediately and I often wonder now what happened with them.
Oh my God yes

He taught himself to play acoustic guitar, that's why this surprised me being written for flute. He seemed an amazing player to me, but I didn't know any better. I used to sit for hours and he would play songs such as '6 white bloomers', 'how much is that doggy in the window' and 'the lion sleeps tonight' he had a friend that he played guitar with every Saturday night but as far as I know he never performed for anyone but us kids. He stopped playing when he got sick.
I don't know how! Haha
Oh wow. Someone did it with the flute sound on a keyboard but this sounds so much better. It gave me vague memories now of dad playing it to me. Thank you so much.

Sit down with your mum and find out what her end game is. She must have some sort of connection to your father, or you wouldn't exist. She may genuinely be falling for him again, it seems like she is tiptoeing around you trying to encourage a relationship (or yes, trying to force it, which is wrong) and hoping that you can all get along. There's loads of reasons this could be happening, maybe she is concerned about you and needs help, or is trying to put another person in your life that will hopefully have your back. Perhaps make a list of questions (are you and him romantically involved? Why do you want us to have contact all of a sudden? Etc) and sit down and have a heart to heart.
You are about as tall as the length between your fingertips when your arms are straight out to the side
The start of school holidays
Whipped cream. Sounds great in theory but my room smelled like off milk for days.
This. I love the sound of his snoring because it means he is right there, next to me, and in his most vulnerable state. That, and if I didn't learn to love it, one of us would be dead by now.
Totally normal. Try a really random conversation starter; which planet would you live on? Drapes or blinds? If you were a giraffe, what is the first thing you would do?

Being socially awkward, I run through everything in my mind to work out how I will react in every possible scenario. I went on a kind of date a few years ago and I was trying to figure out the payment bit - do I let him pay? But I can't assume that he will? Do I pay for myself and risk offending him? WHAT DO I DO? So my plan of action was to get my purse out and look like I was happy to pay, then it would be up to him whether to pay for me or not. Solid plan, right? We were heading to an all you can eat. I hadn't been to this one before but I had been to another owned by the same people, and you paid as you went in the door then paid for drinks as you go. So I meet the kind-of date at the restaurant, he was waiting for me. At the door I start to pull my purse out but he walks straight to a table. 'sweet', I think. 'He's already paid, I don't have to look awkward'. So we have our meals and have a great time. At the end of the night we leave, I go straight out the door with nary a concern. Then I turn around to see where he is, and he's standing at the counter paying for our meals. I died a little inside that night.

It feels dirty, and I don't want anything to do with it.

I'm almost 40. My scars are as bad if not worse than op, over both arms and both legs. In my early 20's I covered up all the time. Mid 20's, I wore short sleeves in select company. Late 20's I relapsed. Early 30's I stopped giving a fuck what people thought. I also discovered most people don't give a fuck. Mid 30's I forgot I had them. Now I only notice them if something draws my attention to them. And the last time anyone actually asked me about them? Early 20's.

Why not sound her out, perhaps by watching a movie with cross dressing and see how she reacts? Or maybe when you are both in the mood, whisper to her that you'd like to try on her panties, that way if she reacts badly you can laugh it off. Keep in mind that someone you have to hide from is not a partner.

Her mental state is not your responsibility. YOUR mental state is your concern. Get her to a therapist, and you get to one, too. Call an ambulance if she mentions active plans for suicide. I might sound like a bitch, but as someone who's been there, do not set yourself on fire to keep someone else warm.

Break up. If you're having second thoughts about your relationship because of a third party's throwaway comment, then you're right--he's too good for you. If you truly love him and don't care about appearances then what you overheard would have meant nothing.
Stay patient. Pushing her is a really bad idea right now. Get acquainted with Mrs palmer.

Oh sweetheart, this breaks my heart. You feel what you need to feel, don't let anyone dictate how you 'should' be feeling. You go ahead and cry, or scream, or walk through your days with your head held high and your heart locked down. What ever feels right to you. Take the help that people offer, they want to make things easier for you, let them. Tell people you are not ok. You don't need to tell them more than that. Let yourself remember your baby as much as you can, hold her in your heart. You are not alone, when you are ready, reach out to the links people have suggested above. Much love to you and your daughter, I'm so sorry.

WRITING.TITLE: I finally cried, Mum
WRITING.TEXT: Tonight I cried, Mum. For the first time since we started trying to get pregnant 3 years ago. I didn't cry through the initial doctors appointments. I didn't cry the first time I had an internal exam. I didn't cry when I had surgery, or the hormones, or being gut wrenchingly disappointed every single month. Not when they said there's nothing wrong with me. Not when I was 3 weeks late but it turned out to be nothing. But tonight out of nowhere it came. How unfair it is. How much it hurts to face the realisation it will probably never happen. How much I hate the well meaning advice - 'just relax, stop stressing, it'll happen'. How much I resent every damn friend who announces their pregnancy. I cried. A lot. Then I got up and ate a packet of chocolate pop tarts. I can't tell you this Mum because Dad died not that long ago, and I know you desperately need your girl to be ok. I need you mum, but I'm OK.
That little smile he tries to hide xxx
Oh I hate this! 'just relax, it'll happen.' No.... No it won't, but thanks for reminding me that I'm less than you.
I just wanted to pop in and say, you're a goddamn rockstar, good job.
He's okay.
I literally am a girl so I literally would react in literally the same way
Hey love, I am sooo proud of you. It's not easy to do xxx much love
Your time will come. You are enough x
Oh my God what an awful person

WRITING.TITLE: I'm eating more now than I was.
WRITING.TEXT: I started eating more healthily and swapped out my toasted sandwiches and ice coffees for fresh veggies and water. I still eat a hearty dinner but only healthy stuff during the day. My problem is that I'm always hungry. I have a big bowl of muesli and yoghurt in the morning then a big lunch box filled with fresh veggies, feta cheese, sultanas etc. I don't count calories and I don't weigh myself because of previous disordered eating habits. If I'm eating more than I used to, am I still doing more good than harm?
Also strawberry scented if you use the strawberry flavoured lube
Hugs my love xxx wrap yourself in a blanket with a cup of tea

Oh love, it's really not bad. If you want, get some big tubs, like clothes hampers but closed so you can't see in it, and every morning when you get up, chuck an armful of stuff in there. Then pick a day to spend two hours tipping it out and putting stuff away. I promise you it will come, I used to be messy as hell, (the type to go buy new plates so I didn't have to wash the old ones) but I got to a point where I wasn't dying of embarrassment if someone dropped over. It comes with time. I was mid 30's. Relax, you're fine.

This is the same with my 8 year old stepson, I've been working so hard with him for 2 years now, he's gone from being 90 percent unintelligible to being understood most of the time and even remembering to say 'th' instead of 'd' about 75 percent of the time, I'm so proud of him and his speech therapist gave up!
Thank you, I'll admit it's really frustrating some days having to remind him over and over again! But worth it just to watch him blossom now he's actually heard by his world!
Awww I love Helen too!!

Hey love, there's plenty of help out there if you're willing to do a little research. I used to cut too, I hear you loud and clear, and if you're ready to take a different step, then please google teen mental health in your region, and make a call. It may be 1 step forward and 3 steps back for awhile but even taking that one step every now and then is better than not. You are loved, you are enough, you are beautiful and it's time you let other people help you take control.

I learned this lesson at 12 when I used my finger to scoop out the last of the toffee from the saucepan then immediately stuck my finger in the glass of ice water I had for the crack test. Of course the toffee hardened and stuck to my finger. Peeling it off wasn't fun, my mother trying to help with tears of laughter running down her face just added salt to the wound. I'm 38 now and have never made toffee again.

WRITING.TITLE: 'Celebrity' encourages people to text her for fertility support then sends them a picture of her child and a plug for her show

WRITING.TEXT: I find on this sub that most pictures of OTHER people's mess - brothers, roomates etc- garner a 'ew that's disgusting' response. But those that post their own mess get a positive reaction.

Omg I accidentally flipped the camera to selfie mode when I wasn't prepared for it and actually cried. But seriously, let your mum take the photos, let her take thousands of them, but ask her not to post any of you before you can ok. There will be a time when you are grateful for those photos but you are perfectly within your rights not to have pictures of you posted online without your consent. Your mum just wants to show the world her baby, she doesn't see what you see in the mirror. Ask her can she please text the photos to her friends and family, that way she still gets to show you off and your family still gets to see you but you don't have to see the photos until you're ready. Much love xxx
I saw this 14 hours too late. Are you ok?

I bought trackies. I live in the tropics. I also bought a bathmat that looks like it's splashed with blood when it gets wet, a trick box where a spider jumps out at you, a spine stretcher and a custom made paint by numbers kit, none of which have actually been delivered yet. Ooh, and bamboo bras, that one in excited about.
That's a lot of chocolate chips. What will you do with them?
Tom Cruise... I'll pass, thanks
I hate hairdressers, being forced to stare at your reflection
I'm really deaf someone tell me what was said
I have small tits and not one guy I've been with have ever complained. Every last one of them are just grateful to touch boobies. If you are with someone who complains, get rid of them.
My infertility buddy - the one who was going through the same thing I was, so we were each other's cheerleaders and shoulders to cry on - had a baby this morning and I feel so conflicted

This!! I've learnt to say it straight up now, hints and hopes don't work. 'hey love it's valentine's day this weekend, can you please buy me some flowers?' the pleasure comes from the flowers he picks, when he knows I want something, he actually puts a lot of thought into it and will come back with yellow flowers 'because yellow is a happy colour and you make me happy'. But valentines day means nothing to him, it's not even a blip on his radar, so 'hoping' he will get flowers is setting both of us up for disappointment and anger. I love him too much to put him in a position to fail. Occasionally I'll ask something and it will be thrown back in my face, and that's ok too, because my expectations are not his expectations. I don't take it personally because he doesn't mean it personally. (hey love it's Easter this weekend, can you please buy me an Easter egg? '...' don't be fucking ridiculous, it's a waste of money and you can buy chocolate whenever you like ') He also kind of freezes without any guidelines. He's hopeless with birthday presents, and if I don't point him in the right direction, I'll either get nothing or maybe a pair of socks. But if I say hey love for my birthday I'd love a necklace or perhaps a watch, it gives him a starting point and he doesn't have to worry about getting me something I don't like or want. You can ask for things without being greedy (remember it goes both ways, did you get him a flower?) and he can refuse without being stingy, if both of you are open about your expectations and beliefs.
Wow! Did you notice it get worse before it got better? I'm on day 14 and I feel like my skin is more red and blotchy
Oh. I was hoping for chicken. I'm so hungry.
My doctor has given up on clomid and is pushing me to the next level, I'm both scared and excited

This is my hope but every app wants me to log a starting weight
I like this plan. Thank you guys for not making me feel stupid for being scared to weigh myself

You will. They will fade, I promise. One day it'll get to the point where if someone does spot your beautiful silver strength stripes it will surprise you because you will have forgotten they were there. Mine are 20 years old now and I barely see them anymore, and I can only think of one person in the last ten years or so that has mentioned the scars, and he was a fuck wit anyway so I don't care what he thinks.

WRITING.TEXT: You are so lucky to be able to pull off colours like that. It's stunning on you.

WRITING.TITLE: I don't know how I'm going to get through this
WRITING.TEXT: So, my fiance bought himself a smoker (as in a BBQ that cooks with smoke, not a person with a pack a day habit). He's so proud of it and so excited. I've supported him the whole way with helping him save up - it's a high end one - and researching ideas. It's amazing to see him so passionate and excited about it. My issue is, I really can't stand smoked food. I hate the smell and the taste. In the 24 hours we've had the smoker, I've eaten smoked pork ribs, smoked Maryland, smoked corn cobs, smoked potatoes, smoked brisket, smoked pumpkin and smoked squash. My hair smells of smoke, my washing stinks, my house smells. But I smile and say, it tastes amazing! Because how can you say otherwise when his face is excited and proud of the meal he's made for you. I don't know how long I will be able to eat this for without gagging, and I'm too far into the game now to tell him I don't like it. How can I learn to like the taste?
How is it a dick move to support him in something he's passionate about?
Agreed, which is why I won't tell him I don't like it.
Nice, and it's the truth too. I would be able to handle it every now and then just not every food for every meal.

You're a legend. To answer your concern, I didn't know how much I didn't like smoked food before. I'd had it before and it was take-it-or-leave-it, but I quit smoking a few weeks ago and my taste and smell capabilities have returned with a vengeance, I'm discovering all sorts of things I thought I liked but it turns out that I don't. Sauces are a genius idea!! Thank you!
Yes, if you're a dumbass like me and miss the pit entirely
Me too, 4 weeks today! Congratulations!

WRITING.TITLE: Question about calorie deficit
WRITING.TEXT: I'm just starting out on my weight loss journey. Due to personal reasons, I am not using a scale or weighing myself at all, my goal is to get healthy and drop a clothing size. All the reading I have done says I need to create a calorie deficit, which obviously makes sense. I'm using my fitness pal and fitbit to track my food and exercise. My question is, mfp tells me that I can eat approximately 5000 kj per day to lose 1kg a week, which I've been doing . However I exercise between 30-60 minutes every day and mfp says I burn about 2000kj each day, fitbit says I burn about 2500 calories. This is less than the kj that I'm allowed to eat but both mfp and fitbit seem to be happy with my progress. But if I'm eating more than I'm burning, aren't I still gaining weight not losing it? Why is mfp happy with what I'm doing? What am I missing? Should I be working out even more? Am I not exercising hard enough? Do I need to eat less? Or is it something else? Please help, if I'm not tracking my weight and just 'trusting the process', I need to be certain that the process works!

I squash it all down into the box deep inside my pysche, lock it up, take a breathe and keep going. That box stays locked until the next time something gets shoved in there. I literally picture myself squishing the issue into the box if I start thinking of it. It ain't healthy, but it's working.

Just wanted to pop in and say, thank you for inadvertently teaching me that my weight number is just one tool in my arsenal, not the be all and end all. I never saw it like that before. The last time I lost weight by using scales, I built myself a spreadsheet that would come up in green if I'd lost weight. If I'd gained even 0.1kg, I'd written a formula so it would flash up 'you fat f#ck'. Soon enough I was obsessively weighing myself 4 times a day and eating one meal every two days. That's why I wanted to avoid the scales this time around, so thank you so much for changing the way I see it!! I
It's funny, I'm fine with babies, but I can't handle other people's pregnancies
Get yo sneakers off my counter, boy!

WRITING.TITLE: What should I expect?
WRITING.TEXT: I have FINALLY graduated to the next level of treatment after clomid has failed for 18 months. I've been referred to a fertility clinic and had our first phone conference with them today (I live in a remote town in Australia). The doctor indicated that we will go straight to ivf and mentioned injections and egg collection and fertilising the egg with the best sperm. I'm 38 and she has basically told me that time is running out (this I know). My questions-- what will happen at the clinic? As in, what sort of things will they ask me / do to me? I'm not a socially confident person so it will be so helpful knowing what to expect. Is it normal to be this nervous? I feel like this is my last shot and I'm so scared. With the injections, what sort of side effects should I expect? I've proven to be quite vulnerable to previous hormone treatment and I want to know what I'm up for. Any reassurance or support is welcome. Thank you for reading
That hip though! There's some sort of joke here about squarepants but I'm just too tired for it to fully form
Please do a progress pic! Those things are my inspiration. How good is it that you're at a place where you can inspire others!

It was a lightbulb moment for me when I realised that the numbers on the scale wasn't a GOAL, it was a TOOL. The goal was to feel good, and I realised I sure didn't feel good when I was anorexic. I'm now the kind of person who bounds out of bed in the morning. I weigh myself in the morning and genuinely forget what the number is by lunch time, because it honestly doesn't matter, except to help calculate my calorie goal for the day. I'm so happy for you, that excitement and pride of accomplishing such a goal is incredible!
I paid about $40 aud for the renpho scale and it's great - measures everything and recognises different people.

Are you running in good shoes? I found my feet were killing me in cheap shoes and the difference when I spent the money on a decent pair was phenomenal. Also it could be the way you run, if you roll your foot or land on the wrong part it will do damage.
Try walking, even speed walking, instead of running, it's more forgiving. Or try running on a beach or somewhere with soft surface and see if that makes a difference
I decided yesterday was going to be a zero sweets day and it was HARD, kudos to you for exercising your willpower muscle
Genius. I wonder if it will bother my son too much if I freeze his after dinner chocolates.
Yes, it's brilliant for my diet. I can make the foods my kid and hubby love, safe in the knowledge I won't want any of it when it's time to eat.
Oh my God what a brilliant way of thinking!! Thank you!
How do you know when the flip point is? Are there signs, or just from experience?

God, I went for a ride today and I really wasn't feeling it. Told myself, just get to the weighbridge then you can go home. Then it was, just get to the other side of the weighbridge then you can turn around. Just get to the highway... Just to the access road... Before I knew it I had broken my record for the longest ride and I was so proud but then I realised I still had to get home and it was a hell of a ride bike.
My mantra is, it's better to move than not move
This belongs on r/toptalent or r/nextfuckinglevel

WRITING.TITLE: I got cocky
WRITING.TEXT: I've been working on my health for a couple of months now. I quit smoking, quit drinking, started counting calories, focusing on what's going into my body. Every afternoon I go for a bike ride where 80% my heart rate is in the cardio zone. Every morning I get up at 5am and take the dogs for a brisk walk, and intermittently during that walk I'll break into a jog. All my numbers are going in the right direction, I found calf muscles and biceps, I'm feeling so much better in myself. But I got cocky. Yesterday I took one dog for a walk and broke into a jog. I was surprised by how easy it was, and the dog slowed down before I did. So when I got home, I was bragging to my husband about how much I'd improved and that the dogs were holding me back, perhaps I should try going for an actual run without the dog, I reckon I'd be able to handle it, no worries! Spoiler alert: I could not handle it. I set off today, started at a brisk walk to warm up, then when I crossed the highway I started jogging. I was determined to jog for a solid 10 minutes, how hard could it be? 60 seconds in and I'm gasping like an asthmatic giraffe that needs to sneeze. 3 minutes in and I have to pause to vomit. The next 3 minutes I have so much saliva flooding my mouth and due to the aforementioned gasping, every time I try and breathe in, I'm choking on my own spit. I interchange 30 seconds of jogging with 30 seconds of brisk walking. There's sweat pouring off me and I can feel my face is redder than it has any right to be. At the 10 minute mark I turn and powerwalk home. My husband starts laughing as soon as I make it inside. I collapse face first on the floor rug and decide, nope, definitely not there yet! Anyone have any reassurance--or any tips?
Do it anyway. Make eye contact, smile and say hi. If she takes her earbuds out, you're golden. If she doesn't, just smile and say hi each time you see her.
Wow, saying hello to someone is harassment? Gosh we better shut down every retail job, ever!
Sitting here in absolute awe of the willpower and hard work you've put in, stories like yours motivate me that maybe I can do it after all
I got asked that when I weighed 45kgs, standing outside the pub with a smoke in one hand and a bourbon in the other
what did he cook?

The morning showers are the BEST. I exercise morning and night, my morning showers are a proper scrub up using every product I have and the steam on full blast. By night time I'm wrecked and my shower is the last thing I do before bed, so my night time shower is a basic scrub. I've been late to work because I been enjoying my shower so much
Holy shit!!! I'm so proud of you! Did you take some photos?
Look at y-bells. You can use them as both dumbbells and kettlebells and cost about the same
Damn dude, that's amazing!

My ex rang me from the pysch ward and was absolutely insistent that I turn all the coffee mugs upside down on the shelf as one of them had a listening device and he couldn't tell me while he was here as they'd hear him, and put him in hospital to discredit him.

Yes, Much better from what I hear! Be moved to the other side of the country so his parents could look after him and they managed to do what I was unable to do, and get him off the grog, which has improved his mental health immensely. It would have been a phenomenal effort and although we are now no contact (towards the end, his mental illness turned me into one of the bad guys so it was best for both of us to go no contact) I am so proud.

No! Just do a little more today than you did yesterday. And eat a little less sugar today than you did yesterday. You've got this!! Also, take a picture today. Full body, no sucking in your tummy, from a couple of angles including a close up of your face. You'll use these as your 'before', just keep aiming for your 'after'!
Get up early. I'm up at 5am every day to sneak in a workout before anyone else gets up
I hear you. When I don't feel like doing anything, that's when I tell myself that I need to the most. 'Do it anyway' is one of my mottos.
Maybe she's not in a country that's locked down?
Come up with a meal plan and then do a shopping list, not the other way around. Think of foods you like and google 'healthy way to cook ___'

Yup, although they're pretty generic and tend to be the same thing every day. I also plan in a sugar fix if I think I'll need it, I'm not into denying myself and I find if I allow for a treat size bar of chocolate it prevents me eating an entire packet of Tim tams

WRITING.TITLE: How do I step it up?
WRITING.TEXT: I'm using cycling primarily as a 'get fit' tool. I ride ecru day for between 30 minutes and an hour, longer on the weekends. My issue is, as my fitness has increased in actually struggling to raise my heart rate enough to get in my cardio for the day. I love riding and I want to stick with it but I'm a bit stuck on how I can challenge myself. There are no hills where I live. Going for longer isn't feasible during the week. I'm already in the lowest possible gear. I thought about using ankle weights but apart from that I don't really know where to go from here, any advice is welcome! Oh I should add that I've only been riding for about 8 weeks so pretty new at it. I don't have special equipment and I live remotely so there's no sports stores anywhere close.

Is that from Girl, Interrupted? That was my go to movie when I needed to escape for a bit.

What foods do you have access to right now, list some off and we'll help you pick a meal that is good to eat and as safe as we can get it. I didn't find mine until I was 36. Work on loving life instead. Loneliness sucks, I hear you there, do what you can to prevent it. Build your network
I went skydiving

Well no, they don't necessarily. OP, I have a bag/ pouch thing that I strap to the handle bars, it fits my phone, debit card and a house key. It's also waterproof. Just a suggestion. Try jumping on Amazon and searching 'bike accessories' to give you some inspiration?

Oh my love I just want to wrap you up in the fluffiest blanket and just hold you right now, I'm so sorry you're hurting so much. Can you curl up and binge watch a TV series, let your mind and body relax for a couple of hours?
I used to leave mine on, that way if I gained I could blame the extra heavy t-shirt I was wearing
Aww you're so beautiful
I got up and went. After a week off sick, temperatures at 40 degrees Celsius and high wind, I really didn't want to, but I did anyway. Gave myself heatstroke but hey-ho.
First port of call will be to consult with your doctor, they will be able to help you start safely

Exactly this. Make tiny changes, all day long. Doing something is better than doing nothing. Don't hate yourself or give up if you have a bad day, draw a line under it and move on. Swap a coke for water. Swap a family size packet of chips for a family size packet of popcorn. Halve the amount of oil you cook with. Have chopped up fruit amp; veggies ready to go so it's easier to grab them for a snack. If you want to indulge, then do it. Instead of having a full takeaway meal, just get a burger. Then next time scrape a little sauce off the burger. Then next time take the pickles off. Use my fitness pal and be honest with it. Tiny changes now makes a big difference later.
I think this sub is literally the only place online that I genuinely get excited when someone else announces their pregnancy. So happy for you, OP x

WRITING.TITLE: F/38/162cms [78kgs gt; 71kgs= 7kgs] 3.5 months. I didn't realise how much I'd changed because the scales didn't change much until I put these pictures together.

WRITING.TEXT: It was from his teeth. I yelled at it and kicked out {I didn't connect} and it ran off. It was pretty scary.
It feels like even less in kgs and it's arduous watching the scale barely move day after day, this photo collage was the shot of motivation I needed to keep going
Thank you! I've been finding it hard for the last couple of weeks and just about obsessively combing this sub for inspiration
Keep us updated!
I've just realised I've been doing IF by accident
I'm actually in tears here. SO proud of you, what a rockstar.

I do between 10 and 15 kms every week day after work then on the weekends I go for 20-30km rides. On the shorter rides I push myself HARD to kind of make it count. What are you trying to achieve - lose weight / get fit / strengthen your muscles?
I haven't even started stims yet and I'm terrified. I'm trying so hard not to get my hopes up but I'm so excited at the same time. This is awful already.
OH my bogan brain thought it was butt f*ck nothing haha

I came from a background of, finish what's on your plate, which was ok as it wasn't an unhealthy amount. But when I moved in with my now husband, he used to cook SO much food and pile it all on our plates, it took me so long to stop feeling guilty or rude for leaving food on the plate.
4 months here, and now I can tell if my husband had a friend over during the day that smokes, hours after he left and even if that friend didn't smoke while he was here.

WRITING.TITLE: This is brutal
WRITING.TEXT: I'm over here eating dry popcorn and apple slices when what I really want is to be feeding my soul with a huge cup of coffee and a big bag of malteasers.
This statement makes shower curtains seem ultra creepy
I'm sorry x
I've been strictly warned against caffeine though. I'm struggling with this the most. Sugar is not too bad because I don't eat it often anyway

I'm struggling with the caffeine reduction the most out of everything. My husband laughed at me the other day because I was literally crying because I wanted an ice coffee so bad! I limit myself to one cup a day and nothing else, not even chocolate (!) I don't know if it will make a difference but I need to be able to look in the mirror and say I did everything I could. The headaches were a killer - especially with the no ibuprofen rule!! I used an ice pack on the base of my head and it helped a lot. Good luck x
Also serving sizes are so much smaller than what your brain wants you to think they are.
Also Aussie, just started stims for my first round. Your story is almost identical to mine but I'm 38. Good luck!
It's my colleagues birthday today and I'm going to throw a little party. A tiny party because there's only two of us that work there. But I'll party a little for you, too xxx
Dissolvable panadol. Heat pack on the jaw. Constantly. Chewing whole cloves. I had to deal with it for 4 months before I could get to a dentist.
How did you go?
I bet you made his day though
No advice, just love.

WRITING.TITLE: What does it mean if my doctor wants me to reduce my dose of Gonal F?
WRITING.TEXT: I just had my first blood test after starting stims this morning, and the clinic rang while I was driving home and left a message to reduce my dosage. I couldn't call back as they were closed by the time I got home (I live 300kms away) and I can't find anything on google. Why would I need to reduce the dose? Does it mean something is going wrong? This is my first round, in case you can't tell #128556;
I will never not watch this. It makes me chortle every time

EAT. I cannot stress this enough. A piece of toast, fruit, cereal, anything. I also used the nausea as a really powerful motivator - if I started smoking again, I'd have to go through all that, all over again. But EAT
Wow you look heaps different!
Did you know your foot is the same length as the distance between your elbow and your wrist?
Thanks guys

Driving a 600km round trip every two days for bloods and scans when I'm hormonal and achy SUCKS BALLS. Also my nipples feel like someone has had a go at them with 36 grit sandpaper. Thanks for listening x

My clinic basically said, just live healthy, drink so much water and eat your veggies. I voluntarily cut out caffeine (mostly haha), sugars, refined carbs and amped up the exercise. Until this last week of stims and I started getting really uncomfortable, then I ate and did what I damn well pleased.

WRITING.TITLE: My RE called to say they won't do the transfer this month because they're really worried about OHSS. Then they said they won't do it next month either so I have time to recover. I'm so gutted. I know it makes sense but I can't stop crying.

WRITING.TEXT: This is the view I'm trying to take. Two more months of getting stronger and healthier.
I have to say, I'm so glad I'm older and much more mentally healthy than I was 10 years ago, this is not a journey for the vulnerable!

Stay mellow :) the hormones make EVERYTHING far more dramatic than usual. Don't react to it and don't dismiss it either. It's such an egocentric thing to go through as a woman, she will be so wrapped up in her body and what's happening. Work with it and don't feel hurt or slighted x
That does help, thank you
Next time he's hanging his washing out ask if he's washing his small dick jocks
How awful for you. This is such a hard thing to go through.

I was so scared the first day of injections. I picked a huge fight with hubby (a day long fight over whether you're supposed to use sleeping bags in swags or sheets amp; blankets #129335;. To which I still don't know the answer) my stepson spent the day avoiding me and I cried more times in one day than I have for years. Today is SCARY. I hear you. Your head is going to be haywire no matter what and you get given horrible awful great news. You do you, today. Turn your phone on do not disturb. Your family will cope. Put on Greys Anatomy and go get some ice-cream, put your feet up and busy your mind with mcdreamy. We're here with you x

WRITING.TITLE: I asked a stupid question
WRITING.TEXT: We're going through our first round of ivf and tomorrow is my first egg retrieval. I'm nervous. This morning I asked my q to please not get wasted today, I needed him to be present and with me. This morning, curled up in bed together, he happily agreed. He was wasted by 2pm. At first I was really angry, then I cried, then I got sad because I didn't realise how bad his addiction was until now and me asking him to abstain would have made it so much worse for him. Then, I sighed and let it go. There's no point getting upset, right? I asked him to do something nearly impossible for him so I have no right to be upset that he couldn't do it. But goddammit, I needed him today.
No advice, I just wanted to say it's such a lonely journey but you are not alone x
Even your dog looks disappointed with your standards
Tell them they're a lot better looking when you drink too but I guess you're both going to be disappointed. Seriously though, what a loser. Then, not you. You're a rockstar.

I was at the hospital chilling on my friends hospital bed while she was in the labour ward. I was at my lowest weight and looked like a stiff wind would blow me over. A nurse walked in, looked at me and asked if I'd been induced yet. That fucked me up for years.
Fingers crossed for you!
THIS SUCKS. I'm hurting so much today.
I had 10 or more follicles that were 15-20, and about 10 more between 10 - 15. My retrieval was yesterday, they got 8 eggs, 5 matured, 2 survived the night.
I'm so bloated it's insane. Had my first retrieval yesterday and it didn't go great.

Your body is LOVING you right now!! Well done, it might not seem healthy in your head but oh wow, imagine all those little processes your body can now do with ease instead of struggling to find the energy. It can now concentrate on things like growing your beautiful fingernails, making your hair all shiny and silky, working at getting rid of the spots on your skin, moving, thinking, fortifying your immune system and so on. You're a superstar, I'm SO FUCKING PROUD.
Aw thanks, my cake day is not a happy anniversary for me so I'm happy to let it slide x
I hear you. You've had a rough run x

Thanks. I found out today that only two eggs survived so far so I'm really bummed about that. Yeah I had chia pudding for breakfast this morning for the fiber, it's not an experience I'll be in a hurry to repeat!

It's a normal reaction. Not a HEALTHY reaction! But normal. You want revenge and this is how your mind seeks it because this is your normal. It's OK to have these thoughts. It's not OK to act on them. Don't get sick to spite him. Get fabulous.

Thank you, this actually helps a lot. I don't know anyone in real life who's been through what we're going through and it's hard for others to understand. Most of my friends are Pringle's packets. They mean well and have their hearts in the right place but they don't get it.
It's going to get worse yet. You will need to be strict with yourself to not give in. Also, get yourself some colouring in books, and do some of that to keep you distracted

I broke up with my long term boyfriend and got gastro in the same week. I lost so much weight that people I'd known for years didn't recognise me. I thought it was great at the time but looking back now... Not a healthy reaction

This is what I was wondering. What the hell are you thinking, picking up a package in a cemetery and unwrapping it? It's likely to be something that someone has made for someone that died. I mean, not the case here apparently but still...

WRITING.TITLE: Has anyone heard of ovaries moving during retrieval?
WRITING.TEXT: I had my first retrieval on Monday, and the doctor told me something that I didn't really pay attention to at the time. She said she had to leave 4 eggs behind because my ovary on my right side had moved higher, there were blood vessels and stuff in the way and she had to do what was safest and leave them behind. Given I only got 8 eggs, leaving four behind is a significant number. Has anyone else had this happen, or heard of it? Does it make sense to people with more of a knowledge of biology than me? Shouldn't this have been noted during my scan a couple of days prior? This was never mentioned to me as a risk and there's nothing I can find online.
Thanks. Trying to stay positive. 8 retrieved, 5 mature, 2 fertilised. Waiting on the 5 day update tomorrow but I'm not holding my breath.
The way you worded this made me laugh. 'welp, I might just wander around behind here for a day or two'. Has it impacted your egg retrieval?

WRITING.TITLE: It's not looking good for my embryos
WRITING.TEXT: The lab nurse called today, one only has 5 cells on day four and the other has a good number of cells but hasn't started compacting. I never knew I would invest this much worry and energy into a clump of cells. Keep your fingers crossed for me
Dude I take pics every time I feel like I'm kicking ass
So many people have commented that they had no symptoms at all and it still worked.
This isn't a journey that anyone chooses to go through, and it's really f#*king hard. I don't have any advice but I wanted you to know that I'm listening #10084; #65039;
It took me about 15 minutes a couple of weeks ago, and that was with a couple of breaks hanging off the lane rope. I thought I was pretty fit, but that put me in my place
This made me tear up. I reckon this is possibly THE most supportive group ever. So much compassion, understanding and genuine joy when it works for someone else.

I'm 38 years old and I had AN for about 10 ish years as a teen/ early adult. Can I just say, I was never skinny enough back then as soon as I hit my gw, I'd just drop my gw. I used to cry when I hit the gw because it was supposed to be the magic number but omg I was still so fat. I told myself, 5 more kilos, 2 more kilos, my thighs still wobble when I jump up and down so 5 more kilos... I was so ill. I look back now at the (very few) photos from that time, as an almost middle aged woman and at an almost overweight weight, and my heart breaks for baby me. There is so much pain behind those dead eyes and fake smiles. I should have been having fun then, running amok, going camping, travelling overseas but instead I stayed in my safe places so I can eat my safe foods and wear my safe clothes and avoid all the questions, and convince myself that I was ok. I guess I'm trying to say to you, you have that mindset now, you will still have that mindset at your first gw, then you're second gw. Your body and your weight is not the problem here, the chemicals in your brain are. You are beautiful NOW. I promise. I don't know you but I can guarantee I can find beauty in you. One day, you will find this beauty too. Please don't get hooked up on this 'I won't be good enough until...' mentality.
Then don't aim for skinny. Aim for strong.

I just found out today that none of my embryos survived to freezing stage. I don't feel that upset. More inconvenienced. But a week ago when they 'only' got 8 eggs, I cried all day. I'm thinking emotional fatigue. I'm just locking it down and moving on. It's OK to feel what you're feeling - even if you're feeling nothing at all. We're here to listen if you need to vent or sit here in companionable silence if you need to chill. And stop worrying about not worrying. Roll with it xxx
Click the three little dots under his comment
Thanks, I didn't know. If you find out then let me know
I was pretty surprised when he fell asleep on my thigh whilst attempting to give me head.

WRITING.TITLE: I'm ok.
WRITING.TEXT: TTC for three years naturally with no success and feeling gutted every month when my period came? That's ok, lots of people have trouble, and you aren't 20 anymore. See a gynaecologist who put me on tablets that had bizarre side effects? It's alright, it might help, it's worth it. Go through surgery so they can go and have a look and see what's wrong, only to find absolutely nothing? No worries, it's a good thing right? Nothing is wrong. Covid hits and your gynie tells you over the phone to just keep going with the current treatment, only to find out that 12+ months on clomid is not a good idea? I'm ok. It's ok. Finally get a referral to a fertility clinic? YES. Develop high estrogen and your ovaries are going insane during stim stage? I'm ok, it means there's lots of follicles, it's good in a way. Your husband gets called out bush for the second week of stims so you're caring for your stepson while travelling 600km every two days for bloods and scans, getting up at 3am and not being able to go to bed until 9pm because that's when you do your injections, while working as well? I totally got this. Getting the call telling you they won't do a fresh transfer because I'm high risk of OHSS? This sucks, but I have two more months to get stronger. Going for retrieval only to come out of anaesthesia to be told that all those follicles only had 12 eggs, and they could only reach 8 of them? Ok that hurts. Literally, they must have been jumping on my ovaries in there. Only 5 mature? 5 is heaps! Only two fertilised? You're ok, you only need one... You're ok. Only one left one day four? Shit... You only need one, it's ok. None left on day 5? I'm ok. I'm ok.
Did something happen to it that might cause a break? Can you feel any lumps that aren't usually there?
Yep that sums up what I thought too. A very anti-climatic end to the loss of my virginity, in more ways than one
This bit sucks. Are there any safe foods you can handle right now? You can get some low cal crackers that are great for nausea
We're all warriors here. Tonight I'm a broken warrior. Tomorrow I'll shake it off and move along.

I really wish that people didn't keep asking if I'm ok. I mean, of course they will because they love me, but seriously, stop looking to me to hold it all together and let me fall apart for a hot minute without pouring pity on me, you know? Much love to you.
Can you guys imagine if we all got together? There would be so much power, love, compassion and fortitude in the room #10084; #65039;
Yes, very. It was a one night stand I found at the nightclub with the express purpose of losing my virginity.

My Q sprung up out of bed one night and kept saying 'what's that?' while staring intently at his side of the bed. Being dark, of course my instinct is to run my hand over where he's staring to find what's bothering him. It was pee. To his credit he helped me strip and remake the bed and took himself to the shower. It's a hard ride living with alcoholism. I hear you.
I got bloated and constipated
It's the start of the action part. No more waiting - it's all systems go now.
No, I woke him up and kicked him out

Research before you go. Pay attention when you're in public to people with a similar body shape. What looks good? What length shorts/ skirts work? Do pants need to be flared or skinny? What length sleeves looks right? What style collar? Are they wearing a belt? Is it wide? You can google but online pictures aren't often realistic. That way you have a bit of an idea where to start. Also don't be afraid to say, I'm having a bad day today, it's probably not a great day to go clothes shopping because I'll feel negative about my body.
That's so cute

Incorrect. I had an employee injure himself after specifically being told not to do something (do not carry that bucket of chain, put it on a sack trolley) and doing it anyway. Had witnesses and the employee admitted he knew he wasn't supposed to do it. We still had to pay work cover.
Holy shit!! How's your willpower muscle?! Iron-strong!
Imagine how many people think the same about you #10084; #65039;
Thank you, I'd never heard of this before! I wonder why the re didn't mention it?

I've been 5 months and today I couldn't buy bread from the shops because I knew if I went to the shops I'd buy a pack. But it was really easy just to not go to the shops. The cravings don't go but they get easier to deny.
These are great numbers! Fingers crossed everything keeps heading in the right direction!
I asked today, they said there's not much in the way of studies to say it makes any difference but it certainly won't hurt. I went and bought some, thank you for letting me know
Don't forget to drink ALL the water #10084; #65039;
I'm in charge of recruitment at my company and if there's a cover letter, I'll read it. If there's not one, I don't miss it.
Good for you!

WRITING.TITLE: Anyone experienced itchiness as a side effect?
WRITING.TEXT: It may well be psychological but from the day after or two days after egg retrieval, I'm getting itchy skin mostly in my hands and feet. No source to the itching (like a mosquito bite) it's just kinda itchy on my whole foot or hand. It's driving me insane and has been going for a week now. It might be stress but I don't think it is. Anyone else had anything similar?
And if your email address is sexgod6969@hotmail.com it's time to get a grown up email address
Bad title, not a 'white person', not a gif, about a sexual assault. Better luck next time mate.

Uh, I think you misinterpreted what I wrote. If they have a cover letter, great. If they don't, no worries, I'll read their resume instead. I do my judging from the interview not from a document that's going to tell me what I want to hear.
No, but people who have poor reading comprehension skills definitely start off on the wrong foot.

To be honest, I would hope so. I've never had that many applicants for a job so I can't answer for sure but I hope that I would have the time to fairly consider everyone's resume. The hardest thing I come across is weeding out the applications of those only applying to meet their welfare obligations and have 0 interest in actually getting a job

I think two is going to be my limit, too. Partly for financial reasons - how can people afford to do 5 or 6 rounds?! - but also, the roller coaster is hard!! I haven't been that mentally fragile for years! Hold your head up xxx you got this.
I am abroad - in Aus- all up, one round cost me about $5500 usd. I mean I don't have that much money lying around.
Congratulations, that's an amazing result!
How many rounds of ivf have you had? Fingers crossed for you!
I ask them to turn me sideways. Only one hairdresser ever gave me shade for it and I just never went back there. One hairdresser said, you think you've got it bad? I have to stand here all day!
Why not mark the bottle where the top of the liquid is now so you can see if the level dropping correlates to him disappearing into the bathroom?
Yep I agree it's underhanded. What about moving it to under the kitchen sink? Clean out the bathroom cupboard?
My last ER there were 4 eggs they couldn't reach. They only got 8 and none survived fertilisation

Holy hell. I'm in Australia, and my total expenses for one round (excluding implantation as none of the embryos survived) including travel, accommodation, vitamins, meds etc was about $8,000 aud or roughly $6000 usd. How do you guys come up with the money?
I hate it when I look in the mirror and I'm all like, shit I look so skinny but then I take a photo and the mirror lied.

Are you kidding, that's fucking huge!! It's restraint, confidence, mental strength and your illness allowing you to put someone else ahead of your illness for awhile. Dance for a minute, you're a superstar.
I'm so sorry x
Interesting - we were specifically told not to take fish oil

Take it day by day. Start meditation if you can, or develop a way to 'find your Zen', I used painting and listening to music as my meditation. You will need a way to make everything pause for an hour or so, so you can regroup and process. Don't neglect your partner, we get so wrapped up in ourselves (and rightfully so) that's it's easy to forget that he's going through it to.
If they did, I don't recall. They rattled off a list of supplements to take and ones to avoid. Fish oil, vitamin c and glaucosamine were all on the no list.
It may be because the supplements I was told to take daily might have enough fish oil in it already.

Do you live on your own? My solution to this problem is, don't buy the food. I don't keep snacks in the house apart from my sons school snacks. Only fruit and meal components, if I'm truely hungry then I will make a proper meal, if I'm hungry cos I'm bored then I can't be bothered cooking

Don't stress too much. The most important thing is that it's taken at the same time every day. Your specialist may need to switch some things up- not entirely sure on the details but mine likes me to do my injection at 9pm so they can time the blood tests I think? But I spoke to them about changing the time for my next round and they weren't worried. Keep doing what you've been doing and call them on Monday.
Those beautiful thighs have held you up for 27 years #10084; #65039;
